lessonSubtitleText: Test how well you know this story

questions.text: After the flood, what command did God give human beings?
answers: Have children and fill the earth
Build cities and stay together
Build really tall towers
Gather all animals into the ark

questions.text: After the flood, what did everyone on earth have in common?
answers: They spoke the same language
They all had the same eye color
They all had different languages
They all worshiped idols

questions.text: What did the people decide to build?
answers: A city with a tower that reached to the sky
A golden version of Noah’s ark
A temple to God
A massive wall around the whole earth

questions.text: Why did they want to build a tower?
answers: To make a name for themselves and not be scattered
To get closer to the stars and explore them
To protect themselves from another flood
To go bungee jumping

questions.text: Why was God not pleased with their building project?
answers: They were disobeying his command to fill the earth
The tower was too tall and unsafe
The tower wasn't tall enough
They used stones instead of wood

questions.text: If the people worked together, what did God say they would be able to do?
answers: Anything they wanted
Defeat God himself
Nothing at all
Just farming and building small homes

questions.text: What did God say he was going to do?
answers: Mix up their languages
Destroy the tower with fire
Send another flood
Shake the ground and knock over the tower

questions.text: When God mixed up their languages, what did they stop doing?
answers: Building the tower
Working in the fields
Worshiping together
Traveling across the land

questions.text: What did the people do after they stopped building the tower?
answers: Gathered with those who spoke like them, scattered over all the earth
Stayed in one place and tried to learn each other’s language
Destroyed the tower themselves
Started building smaller towers

questions.text: What does the book of Revelation say will happen in Jesus’ forever kingdom?
answers: People from all languages will praise God
Only one language will remain on earth
We'll build a tower together to heaven
God will mix up our languages again
